results.title: Spider-man [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Marvel Entertainment, Laura Ziskin, Ian Bryce and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: Sam Raimi (famed for his iconic horror work in Darkman and Evil Dead) delivers - “Spider-man”, adapted from the Marvel Comics book character, is a canny mix of entertaining CG imagery, exhilarating action sequences, and a humanistic portrayal of the man behind the mask. Initially Spider-man aka Peter Parker is an awkward teenager with a smattering of friends and a serious crush on his spunky neighbour Mary Jane. After being bitten by a spider, Parker, much to his dismay, develops super-human reflexes, the ability to project powerful webs, and the knack for climbing walls. Upon experiencing some harsh life lessons, Parker becomes aware of the responsibility attendant with his awesome capabilities. The story also follows the romancing of Mary Jane as she finds her feet in Manhattan and dates Parker’s best friend and roommate Harry Osborne. Raimi achieves impact with this film on an emotional level that has been sorely lacking from so many comic book adaptations. He does this by imparting Parker with problems that an audience can relate to - thwarted love, disappointment, guilt and grief - woes that Spider-man’s phenomenal strengths cannot combat. Maguire imbues the title role with sensitivity and gravitas, whilst character actor Willem Dafoe ably plays a dual role of Norman Osborn, and Parker’s arch-nemesis, the Green Goblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Marvel Entertainment, Laura Ziskin, Ian Bryce and Sam Raimi

results.title: Spider
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Neill S. Bell and Kyle Neaves
results.brief_description: Charts a man’s gradual progress into obsession with catching the spiders that he discovers have infested his basement. Shot using the latest miniature camera technology, the story is told through the eyes of a spider.

results.title: Spheres
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Rene Jodoin
results.brief_description: A play on motion, against a background of multi-hued sky. Spheres of translucent pearl seem to float weightlessly in the unlimited panorama of the sky, grouping, regrouping, at times colliding like some stylised burst of the atomic chain reaction. Set to the music of Bach, played by pianist Glenn Gould. (Awards: Cordoba)

results.title: Sperm cell development in the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This film is chiefly interesting as an example of the use of film in the service of science, in this case, microcinematography. Living cells are shown developing by the use of phase contrast microscopy, a method due to Zernicke, which gives increased contrast by optical means, and without staining.
results.description: This film is chiefly interesting as an example of the use of film in the service of science, in this case, microcinematography. results.title: Spelling it out
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Sabina Baltrukomis
results.brief_description: Shows the teaching of spelling in primary schools from the nineteenth century to the present day. Could be used in conjunction with the Victorian Education Department’s booklet “The Teaching of spelling”. Changing attitudes and a variety of teaching methods are also looked at.

results.title: Spellbound (2002)
results.creator_credit: Thinkfilm, Home Box Office, Jeffrey Blitz and Sean Welch
results.brief_description: This Academy Award nominated documentary focuses on eight children competing in a championship spelling bee. We see behind the scenes meeting the finalists and their families. The tension of the competition is gripping as is looking into the varying backgrounds of the contestants. The high pressure world of the spelling bee and the pressure placed on the contestants can cause a sweat in not only the contestant and their parents but also the viewer. Gruelling competition and high drama are found in this compelling documentary. Having the background knowledge on the competitors adds to the overall enjoyment. Notable is the fact that the winners in most cases are from ethnic backgrounds who are willing to work hard and succeed. There is certainly a great deal of face pulling and mental strain in this moving and exciting film.

results.title: Speedball for girls
results.brief_description: An introduction to the game of speedball. Explains players’ positions on the field, the rules of the game, techniques in developing team co-operation and individual skills - kicking, juggling, volleying, passing and receiving.

results.title: Speed the scrap [Short version]
results.creator_credit: Ace Films, British Iron and Steel Federation and Frank Green
results.brief_description: Emphasises the fact the Britain is becoming more dependent upon scrap metal to maintain her output of iron and steel. Iron ore deposits in the Midlands and imported ore from Africa provide insufficient supplies for new steel; over half the iron and steel produced in the United Kingdom is made from scrap. shows conversion of scrap to new steel in electric carbon-arc furnaces; by-product of process is slag, used as fertiliser.
